readability_reflection: I found string concatenation more readable because it is a simpler process than interpolation.
comprehension_debugging: The syntax for interpolation did not seem very clear. In many of the interpolation tasks, I felt like I was guessing at what the correct answer would be whereas for the concatenation tasks, it was easy to just see how two strings would join together.
preference_rationale: I would use concatenation because it is conceptually simpler and I have prior experience with it.
learning_curve: I have used concatenation before but have never used interpolation. This made it easier for me to understand the concatenation tasks than the interpolation ones.
suggestions_improvement: Concatenation makes it easier to see where a literal string ends and a variable begins. With interpolation, it becomes much more difficult to see that distinction which results in less readable code. Interpolation honestly seems to me to be a solution in search of a problem so I'm not sure what improvements I could propose for it.
